timeline.bodyText: @olegmoz The class name doesn't sound right. How about AreBytesEqualTo or BytesEqualTo.
timeline.author: Vatavuk

+package com.artipie.http.hm;
+
+import java.nio.charset.Charset;
+import org.hamcrest.Description;
+import org.hamcrest.Matcher;
+import org.hamcrest.TypeSafeMatcher;
+import org.hamcrest.core.IsEqual;
+
+/**
+ * Matcher to verify byte array as string.
+ *
+ * @since 0.7
+ */
+public final class BytesAreString extends TypeSafeMatcher<byte[]> {

replies.bodyText: @Vatavuk Thinking about it, I noticed that matcher names usually not mention what they are matching (e.g. IsEqual, not ObjectIsEqual). And having EqualTo is not right, because it may check not for equality, but something different. So I figured that renaming it to IsString will make most sense
replies.author: olegmoz
